titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1827 Oct. 23 : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1827 Oct. 23
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the Tuesday October 23, 1827 session of court, during which both criminal and civil cases were heard. A breakdown of court costs are included for two of the cases. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: Tuesday 23rd.
div1.p: Court convened agreeable to adjournment Present
The Court decide that the defendant pay to the Nation three dollars, considered to be the per Cent due, & two dollars to the plaintiff for damages 23rd of October 1827
Fellony, Charged for stealing a Saddle The Court adjourned untill 10 Oclock tomorrow
The Court acquit the defendant of the charge
The Court find for the Plaintiff $32.00 23rd October 1827

row.cell: Witnesses Jessee Scott attended 24 days at 75

div1.p:
Tuesday 23rd October 1827 Thomas Woodland
vs
John Walker Marshal
The Court find for the plaintiff twenty six dollars

row.cell: Witness Ezekiel Fields attended 28 days at 74 per.

p.add:
Staid Herdsmonths?
Test J Martin C.S.C

div1.p: Court is adjourned untill tomorrow 10 Oclock
